MeasurementToolMetadata.Description: The University of Miami Parkinson?s disease Hallucinations Questionnaire (UM-PDHQ)

umpdhq_severity_01.LongName: UMPDHQ Q01: Do you experience hallucinations?
umpdhq_severity_01.Description: Do you experience hallucinations? (Have you noticed anything unusual about your vision? Have you had any unusual visual experiences? Or ever see/hear/feel/smell/taste things that are not really there or that other people do not see?)

umpdhq_severity_01_types.LongName: UMPDHQ Q01 Types: (if yes) What types hallucinations?

umpdhq_severity_01_dominant.LongName: UMPDHQ Q01 Dominant: (if yes) What is the main type hallucinations
umpdhq_severity_01_dominant.Description: What is the main type hallucinations (used for scoring the UMPDHQ - Other modalities can be annotated/scored in the notes). Mark one only

umpdhq_severity_01_previous.LongName: UMPDHQ Q01 Previous: Not within the past month, but it has happened in the past
umpdhq_severity_01_previous.Description: Previous hallucinations, not within the past month, but it has happened in the past

umpdhq_severity_02.Description: How often do you experience hallucinations?

Levels.1: Occasionally (less than once a week, but continuously)
Levels.3: Frequently (several times per week but < than once per day)

umpdhq_severity_03.Description: On average, how long do the experiences last?

umpdhq_severity_04.Description: Do you think what you are seeing/experiencing is real?

umpdhq_severity_05.Description: How many types of images/sensations do you experience?

umpdhq_severity_06.Description: How severe/emotionally distressing do you find these images/sensations or visions?

Levels.2: Moderately ? produce distress and are disturbing and disruptive
Levels.3: Severely ? very disturbing (medications may be required)

umpdhq_severity_comments.Description: Any notes or comments for severity scoring (could document other hallucination types here)

umpdhq_quality_07.Description: Have you been diagnosed with any eye disease? (i.e. near or far sight problems, double vision, cataract, glaucoma, retinitis, retinal detachment,diabetic or hypertensive eye disease)

umpdhq_quality_09.Description: Was there a recent change in your treatment? Please describe.

umpdhq_quality_10.Description: Was this change related to the appearance or change in the characteristics of hallucinations?

umpdhq_quality_11.Description: Do you experience hallucinations while ?on? or ?off??

umpdhq_quality_13.Description: Is there anything you can do to make the images/sensations disappear?

umpdhq_quality_14.Description: At what time of the day or under which lighting conditions do you experience hallucinations

umpdhq_quality_15.Description: Do the images ever make any sound or noise (for visual hallucinations)?

umpdhq_quality_20.Description: Is the onset of hallucinations gradual or sudden?
